"Boundary" stems from Latin margo ("edge")<[silence:250]> via Old French bounde ("limit")<[silence:1200]>
It marks divisions—physical<[silence:250]> social<[silence:250]> or psychological—defining "self" from "other"<[silence:1200]>
Etymology mirrors its dual role: protection and connection<[silence:3600]>
